We thoroughly enjoyed our four night stay at the Kellidoodle cabin at Timberdoodle. Hosts, Becki and Mark were just a stone throw away if needed and we would see them daily as we came and went. It was nice to know they were right there if need be. We ate at the cabin most nights for dinner and enjoyed using the patio table/chairs provided. We found the wifi to be excellent inside and outside the cabin.
One of my favorite things was the vanity in the bathroom. There was soap, shampoo, body lotion and make up removers all supplied. The towels and sheets were of high quality and I would have loved to have had the same as we continued our travels, let alone for our own home! A few evenings cooled down overnight to the upper 50's and the bedding provided made for cozy sleeping. And speaking of sleeping - the bed was very comfortable - not too hard and not too soft - just right! In the heat of the day a window AC unit did a great job keeping the space comfortable.
We used the kitchen quite a bit. The hot plate came in handy to boil water for corn on the cob and pasta. (You do have to allow extra time for the water to boil!) Detergent is supplied for dish washing along with pot holders and a wide variety of utensils. The refrig was a nice size with a freezer compartment large enough to have two ice cube trays stacked - very nice in the hot summer weather. A Keurig and pods were supplied - for us unimportant as we do not drink coffee!
You can't go wrong staying at this cabin and in this location. It was close to many areas.......Kinzua Bridge State Park, the Allegheny National Forest with Kinzua Beach and Dam. We traveled a short distance away to the Eldred WWII Museum which is quite impressive, especially if you're a WWII buff. We also went south to Cook's Forest State Park, which we had not realized has the such old and tall trees.

Get ready to relax and unwind.
This place is amazing. If you’re looking for a stay that offers rest, relaxation and a stress free time, this is the place to stay.
We went to watch the Perseid meteor shower peak and there was plenty of wide open sky for our viewing pleasure.
HUMMINGBIRDS!!! There are 100’s of hummingbirds, bobbing and weaving between the various flowers and the hummingbird feeders (which you can fill if empty, there was a jug on the back porch).
The porch wraps around the front and side to the back and is covered in both the front and the back. There was more than enough room in the cabin, porch and property. Just my wife and I went this time, but when we go back we plan on bringing our three adult children and our dog.
There are some hiking trails that start right on the property. The trails aren’t clearly marked, so what I did was every time there was a fork in the road I went to the left, that way on the way back it was always going right.
This is great place to stay to disconnect and unwind. A couple days here and you can feel the stress falling away.

review_text: We enjoyed our two-night stay at Jim’s cabin with our two small dogs. He was very friendly on the phone, and we appreciated the contactless check-in. There is one house across the street, but you can’t really see it from the cabin, so it feels like no one else is around. Since someone does live in this cabin, it does have a lived-in feel. We took a walk up the hill on the dirt road behind the cabin, and enjoyed a fire in the fire pit (there was more than enough firewood). There is a big deer head on the wall, which was personally upsetting to us, but we do understand that this is a big hunting area, so it doesn’t affect my review. I just wanted to point it out in case others would want to know in advance; it is in the back room that we didn’t spend much time in anyways. The stairs to the two second-floor bedrooms are steep but manageable, and there is an easily-accessible first-floor bedroom if anyone in your group has trouble with stairs. The bathroom is on the first floor. The town of Bradford is ~15 minutes away, if you need to do any shopping. The wi-fi worked well and was consistent for basic internet use. We have Sprint/T-Mobile and got spotty cell service there. Google Maps tries to tell you the house is located very soon after turning onto the road, but it isn’t. Just keep driving down the road, and it will be the last house on your right when the pavement ends (if you arrive while it is light out, it looks exactly like the pictures; download offline maps if you aren’t sure if you will have service). Overall, this was a very peaceful stay in a relaxing location.
